intro: Cryptolepis nugaalensis, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a shrub native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces distinctive, elongated fruits that contain seeds covered in a fleshy, red aril. It is often found in forested areas and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
